description:
The first part of this trail is on a logging road which at the time I was there had a locked gate at the starting point.  After a while (about 1.2mile) you turn onto some ATV trails (good for MTB) and head towards the falls on the Sackville river.  
The falls are located upstream of a point where the river flows underneath power lines.  I usually wouldn't bother with some of these small waterfalls, but these are fairly close to the city and easy to reach with children.  The falls are in a shaded area composed of deciduous trees but all around the brook are areas that have been logged.  The stream downstream of the falls looks wide and deep enough for a canoe and this might be another way to access this area.  There are a lot of ATV trails in this area that might be good for MTN biking but I did not have the chance to explore yet.
directions: Highway 101 to exit (Beaverbank connector Rd, Highway 354).  Continue on 354 until Middle Beaverbank and turn left on Chesapeake Rd.  Park at end of the road by the gate
title: Sackville River Fall
